title: Folia Performance
body: Markus Lang, the principal double bass player, delivers a visually stunning performance of 'Folia,' specially filmed for GSOplay.

title: Med nordiska toner i blodet
body: At the top of a three-story house with a view of Slottsskogen, resides Markus Lang, the Symphony's new principal double bassist. In a setting adorned with various shades of green from the trees, a melody permeates through the open window. An unexpected 26-year-old with a traditional dark wooden furniture painted in kurbits style.

title: 2021 ISB Solo Competition
body: Markus Lang received an Honorable Mention and the award for the best performance of the required piece 'Computatis Maledictis' by Margi Griebling-Haigh at the 2021 ISB Solo Competition. The unedited competition submission, featuring a collaboration with pianist Jenny Chen, can be enjoyed in its entirety. Audio Engineer: Drew Schlegel. Recorded at Gould Rehearsal Hall, Curtis Institute of Music.

title: Scriabin Poéme, Op. 32, No.1 (arr. for Double Bass and Piano)
body: Markus Lang, the double bassist, accompanied by pianist Jenny Chen, performs Scriabin's Poéme, Op. 32, No.1, arranged for Double Bass and Piano by Gregor Piatigorsky.

title: Bach - Cello Suite No. 4 in E-flat major, BMV 1010
body: Markus Lang, on double bass, presents Bach's Cello Suite No. 4 in E-flat major, BMV 1010, during his Juilliard School of Music Graduation Recital in November 2019.

title: Domenico Gabrielli - Canon for two cellos
body: Markus Lang and Vincent Luciano perform Domenico Gabrielli's Canon for two cellos on double bass.

title: Penderecki: Duo concertante
body: Markus Lang, on double bass, collaborates with violinist Abigail Hong in presenting Penderecki's Duo concertante during Markus' Juilliard School of Music Graduation Recital in November 2019.
